titleStmt.title: Aratea Digital
Baltimore, The Walter Art Museum, MS 734

editionStmt.edition: Digital edition according to TEI P5

availability.licence: This document is published under the Creative Commons licence Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0).

msItem.author: Hyginus
msItem.title: De astronomia

msItem.incipit: Etsi te studio gramatice artis inductum
Sed quoniam quae nobis de terrae positione dicenda fuerunt
Igitur incipiamus a polo boreo protinus discere
msItem.explicit: exoritur cum piscibus et est omnino stellarum XII.

msItem.note: Lib. 4 wihtout the openning and sections 8-11, 13 to the end
msItem.incipit: In estiuo circulo de quo primum dicere instituimus
msItem.explicit: sic igitur orientibus XII signis reliqua corpora occidere et exoriri uidentur.
msItem.note: Skip sections 8-11 on the rotaion of the world together with the fixed stars around the poles, the zodiacal band cut in half by the horizon etc. moving straight to the paranatellonta section 12 (17r-18r).

msItem.decoNote: 39 Illustrations of the constellations on ff. 5v-14r.

msItem.title: Exceprtum de astrologia
msItem.incipit: Duo sunt extremi vertices mundi quos appellant polos

msItem.author: Germanicus
msItem.title: Aratea (vv. 434, 435-436)
msItem.quote: Sub geminis prochion fulgentia lumina pandit. Sors sua cuique data semel assignata tuentur. Imoti loca nec longo mutatuntur in euo.

msItem.author: Cicero
msItem.title: Aratea (vv. 222-226)
msItem.quote: Antecanem graio prochion qui nomine fertur. Hec sunt quae transes nocturno tempore signa. Legitumo cernes celi substancium. Eternumque uolens mundi pernoscere motum. Namque per bis sex signorum labier orbem.

msItem.note: On the planets based partly on Hyginus, De astronomia, Lib. 2, cap. XLII.
msItem.incipit: Septem sunt quae uocantur erratice quorum prima est saturni nomine pheton
msItem.note: On the lower margin of f. 19r: hic celo ornatur trahitur noctemque diemque.

msItem.author: Cicero
msItem.title: Aratea (vv. 227-232)
msItem.incipit: Quinque solent stelle simili ratione notari
msItem.explicit: He faciunt magnos longinqui temporis annos.

msItem.author: Germanicus
msItem.title: Aratea (vv. 437-445)
msItem.incipit: Et stellae via diuersa lege feruntur
msItem.explicit: tempus et ipse labor, patiantur facta docebit.

msItem.title: Excerpt from the Revised Aratus Latinus (Praesepis signa)
msItem.incipit: Sidera quae gentiles presepe et asinos uocauerunt
msItem.explicit: una cum presepi suo inter astra collocauerint.
msItem.decoNote: Preceding the text an illustration of Presepe on the lower margin of f. 20r.

msItem.incipit: Si uis scire in quo anno cicli stella saturni sit fac hos modo
msItem.explicit: et quodcumque signum est in illo est saturnus.

msItem.incipit: Si uis scire quo signo stella uiuis sit fac hoc modo
msItem.explicit: quando conputes et in eo signo iupiter erit.

msItem.incipit: Si uis scire quod stella mercurii sit fac hoc modo
msItem.explicit: et inuenies signum in quo ille est positus.

msItem.title: Excerpt from the Revised Aratus Latinus (Luna)
msItem.incipit: Luna bigam habere dicitur siue propter uelocitatem
msItem.decoNote: Preceding the text an illustration of Luna, personificated as a woman on a biga carrage on the lower margin of f. 20v.

msItem.title: Excerpt from the Revised Aratus Latinus (Sol)
msItem.incipit: Sol dum per trecentos sexaginta et V dies et quadrantem zodiaci ambitum
msItem.decoNote: On f. 21r space left on the lower text field probably for illustration of the Sol.

physDesc.accMat: Binding waste (fragments): two double leaves used as pastedowns on the front and back boards with flyleaves. Text: Julianus Toletanus, Prognosticon futuri saeculi. Origin: Italy (?), s. XI.
